[Portrait]Grand Duke Barrington
[Dialog]After all I've done for you, you now
repay me with betrayal?
You owe me your life, you ungrateful
wretch! You would not stand here
today were it not for me!
Did you prefer digging through sordid
heaps of rubble? Or have you already
forgotten that?{END}

[Portrait]Rapha
[Dialog]Oh, I recall that quite clearly. It was after
you burnt our village, was it not?
Shortly after you murdered my mother and
father and everybody else!

It is not with -betrayal- I repay your
deeds! It is with -vengeance-!{END}

Vengeance? You truly believe
that you are capable of exacting
vengeance on me?
I am your father, Rapha-the man
who raised you from a girl! You
cannot kill your own father.
Though you are welcome to try!{END}

*chuckle* You cannot do it.
Do you know why?

The flesh remembers, Rapha.
It remembers fear, cold and trembling.

But it will not always be so. In time,
your fear will blossom into another
flower-and I shall have that one as well.{END}

[Portrait]Marach
[Dialog]It's true, isn't it?{END}

You meant the words
you spoke just now!{END}

You turn on me as well, Marach?


You truly are an ungrateful lot.{END}

I'll kill him, I will!{END}

Rapha, no!{END}

Marach!{END}

Speak to me, Marach!
Oh, Father, no!{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]Rapha! Marach!{END}

You must be <Ramza>.
Move no further!

If you wish to help your brother,
Rapha, bring me the auracite he
carries.
It should be on his person.
Check his robes.{END}

Yes, that is it! Bring it
to me!

Quickly now!
I grow impatient!{END}

Urg!{END}

[Portrait]Man's Voice
[Dialog]I wonder if you would not
relinquish it to me instead.{END}

Marquis Elmdore?
I thought you-{END}

No, dear. This is not a
game of hide-the-Stone.
Bring it here.{END}

Guard yourself, Rapha!
Those are no humans!{END}

You must be the heretic,
<Ramza>.

I suppose I owe you my thanks.
Forgive me for not expressing
my gratitude sooner.
I would have you know I am not a violent
man like Folmarv. Will you not yield the
Stone of your own accord?
I do so hate to see blood spilt
needlessly.

Spare me the struggle, and I shall be
glad to ask Folmarv to return your
young sister.{END}

What have you done with her!?{END}

Mayhap I did not make myself clear.
I would have the Stone, if you would
speak more of that.{END}

I cannot let worry sway me.
It must not go to him.{END}

An adoring brother you must be,
to trade your sister for a stone!

After all you've faced in coming
here, you leave her to her fate?{END}

I have no words for you.{END}

Indeed, it seems the time for
words is past.

Celia, Lettie! The girl carries
the auracite. Take it from her
corpse.{END}

[Portrait]Rapha
[Dialog]Marach... We...we will be
together again soon...{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]Rapha-!{END}

[Portrait]Marquis Elmdore
[Dialog]So...this is the strength that felled
the Gigas-and Cúchulainn as well.    
Celia! Lettie! Come, this night is lost.


If you wish to claim the auracite
I hold, <Ramza>, you had best
make your way to Limberry.
I shall await your coming there with
bated breath.{END}

[Portrait]Rapha
[Dialog]Oh, Marach...{END}
